content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's the code in Julia for this purpose:
```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    sections = split(lines, "# ")
    result = String[]

    question_start = nothing
    answer_start = nothing

    for (i, sec) in enumerate(sections)
        sec = lstrip(sec)

        if sec == "Question"
            question_start = i + 1
        elseif sec == "Answer"
            answer_start = i + 1
        end
    end

    question_end = nothing
    answer_end = nothing
    if !isnothing(question_start) 
        question_lines = []
        i = question_start
        while i < length(lines)
            sec = lines[i]
            if occursin(r"#", sec) && isuppercase(lines[i][findfirst(r"\w+", lines[i])[2]])
                break
            else
                push!(question_lines, strip(lines[i]))
                i += 1
            end
        end
        result = push!(result, strip(replace(replace(reduce((a,b) -> "$a $b", question_lines),"^#" => "",1), "^Question:" => "")))

        question_end = i 
    end
    
    if !isnothing(answer_start)
        answer_lines = []
        i = answer_start
        while i < length(lines)
            sec = lines[i]
            if occursin(r"#", sec) && isuppercase(lines[i][findfirst(r"\w+", lines[i])[2]])
                break
            else
                push!(answer_lines, strip(lines[i]))
                i += 1
            end
        end
        result = push!(result, strip(replace(replace(reduce((a,b) -> "$a $b", answer_lines),"^#" => "",1), "^Answer:" => "")))

        answer_end = i
    end
    result 
end 
```
